problem.p: Particle 1 of mass m1 is initially moving in the positive x-direction with a speed v1,0 . It collides with a second particle 2 of mass m2 = m1 / 3, which is initially moving in the opposite direction with an unknown speed v2,0. After the collision, particle 1 moves with a speed v1,f = v1,0 / 2 , at an angle of 90o with respect to the positive x-direction. After the collision, particle 2 moves with an unknown speed v2,f, at an angle \(\theta\) = 45o with respect to the positive x-direction. Assume that the total external force acting on the particles is zero.
